column2: Interact to open up Spellbook Menu
Interact to open up Channeling Menu
Has not casted a spell in the last 3 months
Channeling will allow you to cast more spells.
has a chance of getting a mutation
You break the spirit of local animals, utilizing in battle against your enemies.
Calms the bestial aspect of man to better ensure your troops cooperate.
You unleash the primal savagery of your allies.
Your skin becomes as tough as a wild boar's.
Your soothing and hypnotic voice draws local wildlife as a bounty for your troops.
Your fingernails turn into razor-sharp claws as you take on a feral aspect.
You thunderously rebuke your foes, comparing them to base animals that had best cower before their master.
You summon a murder of supernatural crows.
You sense whether the individual before you has harmed an animal, spurring you on to greater feats of strength against them.
Everything leather upon your foe dissolves before you.
Those around you appear more like subservient beasts and thus, are less capable of resisting your will.
Your magic transforms your target into its basest form, now acting alike a beast and cursing them with all the problems that may entail.
If you cast this spell immediately before taking on animal form, you can speak while so transformed.
You grow wings from your back, which are strong enough to bear you aloft.
You touch a willing character, creature, or animal, causing it to immediately fall into a deep sleep akin to a bear's hibernation. This state persists for many months.
This spell causes your allies to temporarily put aside their fear of death.
You imprison the soul of your victim, sealing it in a durable vessel of your choosing such as a bottle, vial, or pouch.
You infuse yourself with Shyish, emanating an aura of menace.
Release a spirit from the mortal world to harry your foe.
You can see spirits and souls that are normally invisible to the naked eye.
You can ask one question of the departing soul of a slain character.
You speak comforting words to an individual bereaved by recent passing.
You use the icy tendrils of Shyish to bind enemies within a target area.
You ask and can receive an answer to one question you ask of a specific deceased individual, as long as that question can be answered with a number of audible knocks other than zero.
You forcibly expel the soul from a target.
You deaden one limb of a single target.
A scythe of Amethyst energy materializes in your grasp.
You partly consume the life essence of a foe.
With a touch of your fingers, you can dispatch a critically wounded character.
You cause an iteam to crumble.
Curse anyone who desecrates a tomb.
You call down a lethal wind of Shyish.
You cause target to age rapidly.
You and any of your allies who hold your hands and any who hold their hands, and so on become immune to any damage whatsoever caused by fire.
Causes enemies before you to feel their blood boil within their skin.
You breathe out a rolling burst of flame, akin to that of the dragons of legend.
You cause the target of this spell to have a burning desire for vengeance against you.
You can lay your hands on an open wound and sear it shut.
Target becomes irate towards others around them.
When you call down a conflagration of doom, a fiery inferno engulfs a target area.
You stoke a targets rage to increase their martial ability.
This spell creates a majestic crown of shimmering flame above your head.
You create a curtain of flame.
You send blasts of flaming death at one or more opponents.
You create a ball of fire to cast at your enemies.
You can throw a bolt of fire at an opponent.
A fiery sword materializes in your grasp.
Cook food fast and well, reducing chances of illness.
You unlock the fires of courage in the hearts of your allies.
You render any single fire, up to the size of a campfire inextinguishable.
You wrap yourself with currents of the Red Wind, which shields you against fire attacks.
You impart one batch of food or drink with a fiery potency. This makes food spicy and imbues it with burning flavour and effect of alcoholic spirits to beverages of any kind.
You can speak and understand the language of birds.
You use the mightiest of magic to alter the course of fate itself.
You follow signs in the sky in order to unravel intrigue and plots around you.
You can read the signs in the air and divine clues as to what the immediate future holds.
You look to the aethyr to see your fortunes continue.
You create a disc that floats in the air before you and magnifies everything behind it that is far away.
You can throw a bolts of lightning at your opponents.
You summon a storm of lightning.
You can divine the future in a limited way by reading the stars.
Any piece of equipment related to perception are bound to shine and function more effectively for a short time.
You loosen your spirit so it slips free from your body. While in spirit form, you are invisible, but you can hear and see normally.
You manipulate the Wind of Azyr to write a subtle message in the stars.
You call down the light of the stars.
You read signs and divine clues about what the future holds.
You call down raging winds from the sky.
You are borne aloft by winds under your command.
You can cleanse an area of blight.
You cause thorns to grow inside the body of one character.
You absorb energy from the earth beneath your feet to heal yourself.
You disappear into the earth and reappear.
You cause thorns and briars to burst from naked earth.
Just as animals fatten themselves up before winter, you cause the character you touch to feed on and store the energy of Ghyran.
You convert an amount of liquid (enough to sustain a dozen people for a day), no matter how foul or brackish, into a mildly fermented beverage of your choice.
Your skin hardens until it becomes dense like clay.
You cause a geyser of water to shoot up from an area of natural earth.
You conjure a swirling vortex of leaves to spin about you
You commune with the spirit of a river.
You concentrate the power of life magic in one area or being.
You cause a small area to burn with the heat of summer.
You listen for subtle signs of earth and branch.
You imbue one character or creature with great ability to climb and traverse natural obstacles.
While sitting in the boughs of a tree, you converse with it, gaining knowledge of what it has seen and heard.
You channel the power of Ghyran to give great vitality to plant growth.
You move through wild lands as though traversing the most finely maintained roads in the Empire and leave no trace whatsoever of your passage.
You coat everything in a target area with frost.
You allow a willing creature to take the shape of a tree.
You wrap a daemon in the tendrils of Hysh, using the pureness of light to banish it back to the Realm of Chaos.
You create an explosion of shimmering light.
You wrap a single character in the healing power of Hysh and all damage and maladies affecting him are healed.
You touch a character and reduce one penalty he is suffering.
A dim glow passes over the surface of any item or character, and it is cleaned to spotlessness.
You rend the very Aethyr and cast a group of daemonsback to whence they came.
You create a burst of light.
Your eyes shine with the light of truth.
Your touch heals an injured character.
You use the power of Hysh to aid one character suffering from disease or poison.
You cause the interior spaces of any single building to shine with daylight.
You open your mind to Hysh and let the light of wisdom illuminate a vexing intellectual problem.
You bless a source of flame to burn away corruption and disease.
You cause a brilliant shaft of light to explode forth from your hand.
You focus and concentrate the energy of Hysh into a deadly column of burning light
A character you touch becomes more convincing to others but only if he speaks honestly.
You create a ball of glowing light the size of a Human head that floats around your body, moving slowly or quickly as the situation demands.
Your gaze focuses radiant power on one target.
You temporarily enchant a melee weapon you touch with the radiant power of Hysh.
You surround yourself with a field of light that protects you from ranged attacks.
You cause the armour of a group of enemies to have the weight of lead.
This spell allows you to unlock all secrets of the object, augmenting your own knowledge with the history of those whom have owned it.
You rust and corrode one metal object.
You can temporarily enchant an item.
You subtly alter the composition and characteristics of any single weapon.
You temporarily transmute an object into pure gold, providing you with immediate wealth but fermenting distruct of you.
You summon shimmering orbs of steel that rotate around your body and protect you from incoming attacks.
By passing your hand over any metallic surface, you cause an inscription to appear indelibly on the object.
You cause a solid, inanimate object to become brittle, making it shatter easily.
You transmute a solid, inanimate object, making it harden like steel.
You use the magic of logic to aid you.
Your body and mind become as tough and stalwart as metal.
This spell can be cast in two ways: to record a secret message or to view a secret message so recorded.
You create a number of magical silver arrows.
You cause the forges of your province to produce items of greater complexity and quality.
You touch a metal object and look into its past, seeing the circumstances of its forging and creation as if you were there.
You can transform one metal object into a different one. This does not change the type of metal, only its shape.
You seek to transmute a sick mind into a healthy one, which is quite a dangerous task.
You use magic to guide the efforts of an ally.
You can cast this spell on any one character or creature, confusing it.
You cause the shadows around you to burn like acid.
This spell allows you to perform any act while appearing to do something completely different.
You can take on the appearance (including clothing, armour, and so on) of any other living, humanoid creature under ten feet in height (Human, Elf, etc.).
You make yourself look like a nightmare creature of purest dread.
You make any moderately sized item appear to be either worthless or valuable, whichever you choose.
You cause one character to wholly forget you exist.
You cause someone to appear and behave as if dead to all sight and inspection.
You make your target subtly more or less attractive, but in a way that has a noticeable effect on the way people regard him in social situations.
You create a swirling area of impenetrable darkness.
You wrap yourself in shadow, so you are difficult to detect.
You conjure up a number of shadow knives.
You use the power of illusion to make yourself look fearsome and deadly.
You call forth a dark and shadowy horse.
You shroud yourself with magic and disappear from sight.
The subject of substance of shadow becomes invisible and silent.
You become very easy to ignore. Although people can see you perfectly fine, they tend not to notice you, and donâ€™t recall anything about you after youâ€™ve gone.
You send ropes of inky darkness to throttle any one target.
This is a more potent version of bewilder, drawing on the superior control of the grey wind.
You feel the Aqshy Winds spreading through you, you're now able to use the Lore of Fire and you'll need to choose a sub-school to master.
You feel the Ghur Winds spreading through you, you're now able to use the Lore of Beasts and you'll need to choose a sub-school to master.
You feel the Chamon Winds spreading through you, you're now able to use the Lore of Metal and you'll need to choose a sub-school to master.
You feel the Hysh Winds spreading through you, you're now able to use the Lore of Light and you'll need to choose a sub-school to master.
You feel the Ghyran Winds spreading through you, you're now able to use the Lore of Life and you'll need to choose a sub-school to master.
You feel the Azyr Winds spreading through you, you're now able to use the Lore of Heavens and you'll need to choose a sub-school to master.
You feel the Shyish Winds spreading through you, you're now able to use the Lore of Death and you'll need to choose a sub-school to master.
You feel the Ulgu Winds spreading through you, you're now able to use the Lore of Shadow and you'll need to choose a sub-school to master.
